page.title: 13DOWNLAND FARMING IN AMBERLEY
page.content: Downs Farm has been farmed by members of the Lee and Strudwick family for over 50 years. It was originally rented from the Parham and Norfolk Estates and was gradually bought over the years. Today it is farmed by 7 family members helped by one full time and one part time person. The farm tries to be self sufficient. It has a dairy and beef herd. Sheep are no longer grazed as it is more profitable for fields to be enlarged and ploughed to grow Spring and Winter Barley and wheat. The female calves are for milking and male ones sold for beef. The Wild Brooks are cropped for sileage then grazed in summer. Winter Barley is grown on high ground for winter food, Spring Barley is sold for malting. Wheat grown on lower wetter soil is their main cash crop.
